intro: Mitreola paniculata var. glabra, commonly known as the smooth mitreola, is a small, herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually smooth and glossy. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in branched inflorescences called cyathia, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
